subject: Ethics
title: Cognitive Enhancement Drugs
description: A quick, practical guide to Cognitive Enhancement Drugs.

hook.text: College students pop Adderall before exams like athletes use steroids before games. Brain doping.

buildup.text: Drugs like modafinil and Ritalin can boost focus and memory in healthy people, not just patients.

discovery.text: Surveys show up to 25% of students at some universities use cognitive enhancers for academic advantage.

twist.text: If one student uses them and others don't, the playing field tilts. Is it cheating without a rule against it?

climax.text: We accept coffee and tutors. Where exactly does 'unfair advantage' begin? The line is blurry.

punchline.text: Every era has its shortcuts. The ethics never get easier.

quiz.question: What ethical issue does cognitive enhancement drug use raise in education?
options: The drugs are always dangerous to health
They make students less intelligent over time
They create unfair advantages in competitive academic settings
